intro: Acianthera fabiobarrosii, commonly known as the Barrosia orchid, is a species of orchid native to Brazil. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows in humid, shaded environments within the Atlantic Forest biome. Its flowers are usually pale yellow to greenish-white, with intricate patterns on the petals. Acianthera fabiobarrosii is a rare and endangered species, highlighting the importance of conservation efforts in its native habitat.
